item.horsepower.millstone.description.si: For the millstone to work an [$1]7x7[$2] and [$1]2 blocks[$2] high area is needed
item.horsepower.millstone.description.lo: The millstone needs to be placed [$1]one block[$2] up in the middle
item.horsepower.millstone.description.us: To use the millstone attach a horse with a lead
item.horsepower.chopping.description.siz: For the chopping block to work an [$1]7x7[$2] and [$1]2 blocks[$2] high area is needed
item.horsepower.chopping.description.loc: The chopping block needs to be placed in the middle
item.horsepower.chopping.description.use: To use the chopping block attach a horse with a lead
item.horsepower.press.description.size: For the press to work an [$1]7x7[$2] and [$1]2 blocks[$2] high area is needed
item.horsepower.press.description.locati: The press needs to be placed in the middle
item.horsepower.press.description.use: To use the press attach a horse with a lead
item.horsepower.manual_millstone.descrip: Right click the block with the item to mill[$1]Sneak right click to remove item[$1]Right click block with item in it to start milling
info.horsepower.item.reveal: Hold a lead to reveal area needed
info.horsepower.millstone.info1: The millstone will mill down items to their base components. When setting up a millstone make sure you have a 7x7 and 2 blocks high area cleared before starting, there needs to be solid ground under the 7x7 area.
info.horsepower.millstone.info2: In the middle of the 7x7 place a block of your choice and then place the millstone above that. If the area isn't cleared to millstone will say that when looking at it. Next, use a lead to get a Horse/Donkey/Mule/Llama of your choice to be working the miller.
info.horsepower.millstone.info3: With the animal attached with the lead right click the millstone and the animal should now be connected to that. Now simply right click the millstone with a item that can be milled to start the process or attach any automatic input/output on the top or bottom.
config.horsepower.client.show_manual_cho: Show additional information in The One Probe when sneaking and using the Manual Chopping Block.
config.horsepower.server.plank_data_pack: Generate plank recipes for the Chopping Block and Chopper on world load. When true, on every world join or server start the data will be regenerated. All existing files in the horsepower data pack folder will be removed. When false, the files in your data pack will not be removed! So you can generate the recipe ones and turn this option to false.
Defines the amount of axe chops needed to craft something in the manual chopper. The data will be written into the generated plank recipes data pack.
Defines the amount of chops needed to craft something in the horse chopper. Be aware that the windup time is important too here! The data will be written into the generated plank recipes data pack.
Defines the recipe output for manual chopping. The data will be written into the generated plank recipes data pack.
Defines the recipe output for horse chopping. The data will be written into the generated plank recipes data pack.
